column4: i'm having trouble updating ndiswrapper and its pissing me off
not only that but when I try to install anything it always says directory or file doesn't exist
is there an alternative to ndiswrapper that I can use for my usb wireless adapter
the normal driver in the kernel?
it came with all widows drivers
well unless i want to drill holes in the floor
linux has the drivers built in;  what happens if you just plug the card in?
netgear doesn't provide linux drivers either
now how do I install the driver
I got the zip file, how would I go about installing the driver
